Hydras:

"That's a STUPID QUESTION" sai dHdyras "You have came to MY LAIR a=
nd Dares to steal what is mine?????  SUFFER MY WRATH!!!!"

After this Hydra=
s and PErceptor Opened fire against Tucson and the Maximal invaders


From:=
 Sandy 
Sent: Monday, April 12, 2010 11:58 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
S=
ubject: Re: BlackFortress


  
Tucson nodds to Kup who he respects greatly =
as a comrade.

"You're right, we need to leave. But there's something I nee=
d to do. Cyclonus, if I were you I'd be worried about your fellow Deceptico=
ns, Scourge and Scoroponok. Get them out of here as fast as you can. Hydras=
 is using you as puppets, he doesn't have a shread of compassion for any of=
 you. Go on, be the Decepticon you wish to be. It's a right that even I can=
't take away from you." 

He then turns to Hydras.

"I'm sorry I can't save=
 you Hydras. You've slipped through the cracks and there isn't anything I c=
an do for you, except defend those who truely deserve to be protected."

He=
 aims his missile launchers at Hydras.

" I believe you know what these are=
 capable of. It's your choice Hydras, what will it be?"

--- In nbwrpg@yaho=
ogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Kup/Darkhawk/Perceptor/hydras:
>=
 
> "No!!!!!"Yelled an angry Darkhawk before fell in stasis, Kup managed to=
 drag him away of the Predacons.
> 
> "We need to move out!!!"yelled Kup
> =

> Hydras Was very mad this time "DONT LET THEM RUN AWAY!!!!! PRIME WITH MY=
 BARE HADNS I'LL RIP THE MATRIX and YOUR SPARK OUT YOUR BODY!!!" 
> 
> Perc=
eptor continued Shooting agaisnt the MAximals
> 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sen=
t: Monday, April 12, 2010 10:31 PM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject:=
 Re: BlackFortress
> 
> 
> 
> OOC: Tucson collapsed due to extreme exhausti=
on and some moderate burn damages from the magma. Yes, even magma didn't st=
opp him from trying to help his comrades. He's got some burn marks in his a=
rmor, and that's his damaged state for now.
> 
> BIC: 
> 
> Perhaps the pow=
er he had extended outward, was in vain. Tucson lies on the ground for a mo=
ment or so, but slowly rolls back up onto his left side, holding up his upp=
er body with his arms which shake under the sheer pressure of his weight. H=
e looks around, and finds Darkhawk, severely weakened by the powerful blast=
. Night Shift wastes no time in slapping a pair of stasis cuffs on Darkhawk=
, who in reality was Windlord.
> 
> "Gotchya. Don't worry, you're in good h=
ands now. Yo, Kup! Better take this guy for me, I think Tucson Prime's comm=
n' around."
> 
> Tucson calmly looks around yet with a stern expression on =
his face.
> 
> "Not - the result I was hoping for but - it did enable us to=
 get somewhere. Can't - have it all I suppose, but doesn't mean we're givin=
g up all together."
> 
> Slowly he makes it onto his knees, and then plants=
 one foot down on the ground, hoisting himself up to his feet, with a bit o=
f a stumble. He was weak, extremely weak, and it was questionable wether or=
 not he would be able to continue fighting. He didn't want anyone to see hi=
m in such a condition though. He fights his weakness and tries to shrug off=
 the grogginess he feels. Night Shift nodds in agreement with Tucson Prime.=
 
> 
> " I hear ya on that one big bot. Sometimes, ya win some, ya lose som=
e, and sometimes it's kinda like in the middle of both losn' and winn'n."
>=
 
> Tucson understood that the mission itself would be difficult so he prep=
ared himself for the unexpected by working with that uncertainty that plans=
 don't always go as they are intended. He shrugs off the fact that Cyclonus=
 is not even scathed by the energy attack. He was now curious about Rodimus=
 and how he had handled it. 
> 
> " Something - Rodimus wasn't too good at =
doing. I have a feeling he may not have taken this too well, Nightshift."
>=
 
> Nightshift narrows his optics.
> 
> " Lemme tell ya somethn' Tucson, be=
fore you became a Prime, and he was on the job, it didn't look like his spa=
rk was totally in his work. But you, the quiet guy in the corner, the guy w=
ho threw caution ta the wind ta save his comrades, the guy who faces advers=
ity as it comes and ain't afraid of it, and the guy who actually learned fr=
om his loss rather than complain'n about it. You got what it takes, and alw=
ays had it. It - just wasn't obvious because you're too modest for your own=
 good and you kinda just kept ta yourself most of the time."
> 
> Tucson li=
stens thoughtfully to Nightshift.
> 
> " You're right, I wasn't much for wo=
rds at the time... But back then, I wanted to approach Rodimus on his not s=
o pleasurable attitude on his position as a Prime. It seemed as if he didn'=
t want it. And you know, responsibility isn't for everyone. And for some, i=
t's second nature."
> 
> Night Shift nodds.
> 
> " Understandable. Now I ad=
mit, I dunno if I could ever take your job big guy. Not that I ain't capabl=
e of it, I know I ain't a good match for the position. And I ain't afraid t=
a admit that."
> 
> Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies Cyclonus once more=
. Something dawns on him. He seemed relieved to be free of something. 
> 
>=
 "Is it me Cyclonus or do you appear to be liberated of something that may =
have been holding you back? Why do you work with Hydras anyway? What is the=
 purpose of working with him when you can be your own individual? Your life=
 should be as you intended, and not what others have intended for you. It b=
oils down to freedom. You have the chance to experience freedom. If I were =
you I'd take that chance now. As a matter of fact, Scorponok, Scourge, what=
 seems to be holding you two back here, when you yourselves can be your own=
 individuals as Decepticons? Does Hydras have you on some sort of leash? I =
see no such restraints so that means if you want freedom you should also ta=
ke it."
> 
> Night Shift could see what Tucson was up to. It was one of his=
 thinking outside the box kind of strategies. And a strategy that would ben=
efit all and not just one faction. Tucson was trying to break new ground, a=
nd as crazy as it all looked, he sits back to watch it all take place. Tucs=
on Prime now steps asside and waits to see if any of them either try to des=
troy him, or actually agree with what he was trying to tell them.
> 
> "Wha=
tever any of you chose, your decision is your own and I will not interfere.=
 We may not be allies, but I do respect the need for one's free will. But i=
f you attack me, do not expect me to be so forgiving."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y=
ahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@> wrote:
> >
> > > Nightligh=
t Nodded, she stood up with fear in her face. she was ready to follow Rodim=
us
> > 
> > Rodimus tapped his code on the door and it slid open. He steppe=
d out
> > of the chamber and looked around for a moment. He nodded, satisfi=
ed
> > that there were no intruders in the hall. He looked back at Nightlig=
ht
> > and motioned for her to follow.
> > 
> > With a grinding of gears he=
 shifted into his vehicular mode and opened his door.
> > 
> > "Come on." h=
e said as he gunned his engine. "I will will protect you.
> > We need to he=
ad towards the throne room. If there is anywhere that is
> > more protected=
 in this place it is there."
> > 
> > He flipped on his lights and once Nig=
htlight had gotten in he took
> > off, burning rubber as he moved!
> > 
> >=
 OOC: Remember, Rodimus and Nightlight should be unaware of Tuscon's
> > in=
trusion, so this since like a good way to bring everyone together.
> > Rodi=
mus acting in ignorance :)
> > 
> > Preston
